cellularData

Class GraphView<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • cellularData.GraphView<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The name of the class that contains cellular data to be graphed
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class GraphView<T>
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener
    Class GraphView creates a JPanel of a graph of cellular data of the number of countries specified by the user.
    Author:
    Timothy Hsu, Zach Rooney
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • GraphView

        public GraphView(int width,
                 int height,
                 LinkedList<T> country)
        Initializes the structure of the graph and the positions of all the points on the graph.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the window of the GraphView panel
        height - The height of the window of the GraphView panel
        country - The linked list of country objects, along with their cellular data

    • Method Detail

      • map

        public static final double map(double value,
                               double dataMin,
                               double dataMax,
                               double plottedMin,
                               double plottedMax)
        Converts the coordinates of cellular data (year, number of subscriptions) into pixel values for positioning on a GUI graph.
        Parameters:
        value - The original value of the cellular data that is to be converted
        dataMin - The lowest value in the entire original data
        dataMax - The highest value in the entire original data
        plottedMin - The minimum position of a point on the graph, in pixels
        plottedMax - The maximum position of a point on the graph, in pixels
        Returns:
        The converted pixel value for a point to be graphed
